meta.content: Nevis, Minnesota is the home of a kindergarten through twelfth grade school, plus preschool and learning readiness. Educating students is an important process. We at Nevis Public School believe every student is important, whether a high achiever or a student with special needs.

blockquote.h5: Mission: To provide an educational environment which emphasizes independent learning as a lifelong process of challenges. Learners must become critical thinkers, develop positive self-esteem, reach their maximum potential, adapt to a changing world, and become responsible citizens.

main.p: If you do need to come to the Nevis High School, we appreciate you maintaining social distancing and entering and exiting the building as quickly as possible.

img.p: The Nevis School will be providing bagged meals (breakfast & lunch). Pick up is at the three T&M Express locations in Nevis, Akeley and Park Rapids. There will be no meal pick up at the Nevis School.
Pick up time is between 11:00 a.m. and 1:00 p.m. Monday through Friday.

Please contact Kathy (ext. 102) in the district to better prepare us so we have adequate supply at each site. This service is provided for any Nevis student. We will do our best to meet the needs and to keep improving the distribution of meals to our students.

div.img: The Nevis School will have a pick up/drop off station located in the East cafeteria. You can use door #10, the door leaving the cafeteria to the playground, to exchange materials with our staff personnel. Pick up and drop off will be from 11 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. ONLY.

School Age Care will be available to those emergency workers (ambulance drivers, nurses, doctors, firefighters, first responders, etc.) from 7:00 a.m. - 5:30 p.m. Monday-Friday. Contact Hannah Spry at 505-913-1180 or by email at hspry@nevis308.org

Preschool Registration
Preschool Registration has been rescheduled to June 29 from 1:00-7:00 p.m. in the Early Childhood wing.

PTA Coloring Contest
Hey Nevis Tigers! Not only are the teachers and staff missing you all, but the PTA is also missing all your smiling faces! So we have decided to offer a coloring challenge for grades K-5th. Show your Tiger spirit & creativity! A winner from each grade will be drawn and receive a prize! The coloring pages are here for you to choose from and print off, or can be picked up at either the meal pick up locations or at the school pick up location. Once completed, they can then be returned to either the school pick up location or at the meal pick up location. Deadline is May 4th! Any questions, text Stephanie at 218-255-4390.
